stepTitle: Calculate the approximate number of atoms in a bacterium. Assume that the average mass of an atom in the bacterium is ten times the mass of a hydrogen atom.
stepBody: (Hint: The mass of a hydrogen atom is on the order of $${10}^{\left(-27\right)}$$ kg and the mass of a bacterium is on the order of $${10}^{\left(-15\right)}$$ kg.)
